metadata.title: CVE-2024-35908 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tls:get psock ref after taking rxlock to avoid leak At the start oftls_sw_recvmsg, we take a reference on the psock, and then calltls_rx_reader_lock. If that fails, we return directly without releasing thereference. Instead of adding a new label, just take the reference afterlocking has succeeded, since we don't need it before.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
